title: Widevine DRM is not working on Firefox Browser
content:
Dear Firefox Team,

We have applied Widevine DRM on Videos, where the Videos are loading from Azure Media Services. We are facing the issue that we are not able protect our Video content on Firefox browser.

Please help us with the resolution of the issue.

awaiting early reply.

Regards, Srikar.
creator: srikarrao.ghone

title: Firefox causes disappearing and flickerin cursor when in window
content:
Suddenly Firefox causes my cursor to disappear and flicker at times when inside the window. When it is in the browser toolbar like addressbar and etc. the cursor simply flickers but when in the main browser window it disappears

I checked a various things such as reinstalling, making sure that caret mode is off, safe mode, but it still occurs.

Firefox is my main browser and it is so hard to use it if I can't see my cursor.

I don't know how to fix this issue. Thank you for your help.
creator: ugniteous.gaming

title: On computer restart, firefox factory resets itself, last 2 days
content: On computer restart, firefox factory resets itself, all my extension are unavailable so I have to toggle them off then on, i get the 3 initial welcome tabs of firefox, and my theme is removed. this is very annoying, first time I just hoped this was an accident and i put all preferences back but now its starting to waste my time
creator: bld939

title: Firefox 113.0.1 update - Cannot Access the Internet
content: Firefox has automatically updated to version 113.0.1. When it opened my previous tabs had all been closed to I selected the restore previous browsing option. Tabs all loaded with no problem. however none of the tabs could access the internet. I've tried removing Firefox from my Bitdefender fire wall and then restarting Firefox. Bitdefender automatically adds Firefox to the allows list but still won't access the internet. I opened a new tab and typed "Google.com" and got the message "open network login page" telling me I need to login in to the network to access the intenet. My PC is connected via ethernet and I use Nordvpn. I have disabled both Bitdefender and Nordvpn but still cannot access the internet with Firefox but can do so using Brave. I have accessed the Setting in Firefox and changed the Network settings to no proxy. Can you help please?
creator: blackrover

title: Error code: SSL_ERROR_RX_UNEXPECTED_SERVER_KEY_EXCH
content:
After installing the latest version of Firefox, when trying to get to a particular website, I'm getting error code SSL_ERROR_RX_UNEXPECTED_SERVER_KEY_EXCH.

I can access the website on my phone, so I know it's not the website. Help?
creator: rsalbert

title: Secure Connection Failed
content:
Just sent a note, and got a response...but...you suggested this article...This article may help. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/secure-connection-failed-firefox-did-not-connect

Well, it’s nice that they have something mentioning it…but I’m not seeing any indication of a way to fix it…just a description. I already KNOW what it looks like. Like this: Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.bing.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR

Error code: PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

Being as it’s EVERY stinking site, I’m not much up for trying to inform ALL the website owners…as I doubt that it’s their fault. I just want to be able to use the browser as I have for years. So far, this doesn’t solve my problem. Thanks, Ken
creator: ansilatoms

title: Everything is gone:  Settings, Add-ons, passwords....vanished.  Why do they do this when they update?
content:
Who wants to hunt down their cryptically named profile? Who knows where it is? Why put us through this? Do they enjoy aggravating their users or are they just mentally deranged? Why, why, why? Who else does this kind of idiotic behavior? I can't think of a single other program that would elect to erase all of the setup we've painstakingly done for nothing.

All I did was go to the original location to check something and clicked firefox.exe. Then Poof. Did they just do a major update recently? Like today? When it checks for updates it says its up to date but it said that a few days ago I think. Version 113.0.1. I can't even find the previous profile. I see only one file under Firefox\App\bin that says "sqlite3.exe" which I think is how they name themselves. A rational person would name it PROFILE of course. But we're in the realm of the insane.

I do see "profile" in Firefox\Data though but its filled with dozens of files. And there's no indication of any other profiles there. There are several extensions there and as mine were wiped out maybe this is the old profile?

A sensible mind would simply tell us when there's a major update and how to recover everything.
creator: moz2u

title: Can't surf the web since the last update I can recall.
content: No matter where I try to go on the net, aside from the search engines, I get the same Secure Connection Failed error, and trying again does nothing. I've been using Edge, Chrome, and Brave to get to sites, and only come back occasionally to see if Firefox is working again. I even tried a fresh install, and reboot...still isn't working. My anti-virus is Vipre. I don't use any others. Why, after years of using Firefox, is it that suddenly it's useless?
creator: ansilatoms
